title: 103_s1626
content: The Veterans' Home Loan Improvement Act of 1993 may be cited as the short title. Revision in computation of aggregate guaranty is also addressed in the act. The Veterans' Home Loan Improvement Act of 1993 is amended by striking out and inserting new paragraphs regarding loan repayment or release from liability, and loss payment conditions. The Veterans' Home Loan Improvement Act of 1993 is amended by striking out paragraph 3 and all that follows through the end of the subsection. The SEC. 3 authority to guarantee home refinance loans for energy efficiency improvements is amended. The SEC. 3710 of Title 38, United States Code, is amended to allow refinancing of existing guaranteed, insured, or made loans to improve dwelling securing such loans through energy efficiency improvements. The SEC. 3729 of Title 38, United States Code is amended by inserting subsection (a)(11) after subsection (a)(8). Section 3710(a)(2)(E) of such title is amended by inserting 3710(a)(11), after 3710(a)(9)(B)(i). The "Veterans Benefits and Services Amendments of 1994" Act revises the computation of aggregate guaranty for home loans under Section 3702(b) of title 38, United States Code. It also grants authority to guarantee home refinance loans for energy efficiency improvements. The "Veterans Benefits and Services Amendments of 1994" Act allows for refinancing existing VA loans to include energy efficiency improvements. The amount of the loan cannot exceed the balance of the loan being refinanced plus closing costs. The Act allows refinancing VA loans for energy efficiency improvements, with loan amounts determined by the Secretary under regulations. Section 3729(a)(2)(E) is amended to include specific loan purposes. The Vietnam era for certain veterans is expanded to include the period from February 28, 1961, to May 7, 1975, for those who served in the Republic of Vietnam, and from August 5, 1964, to May 7, 1975, for all others. This amendment takes effect on October 1, 1994. Additionally, certain payments to Alaska Natives are excluded from the determination of annual income for pension eligibility. Section 1503(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include cash, stock, land, or other interests received from a Native Corporation under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. Additionally, there is authorization to enter into an agreement for the use of property at the Edward Hines, Jr., Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may enter into a long-term lease with The Caring Place at Loyola, Inc., a not-for-profit organization, to provide temporary accommodations for family members of severely ill children at the Edward Hines, Jr., Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center in Hines, Illinois. The agreement ensures no cost to the Federal Government and may allow the use of the property without rent. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may provide temporary accommodations for veterans with severely ill children at Loyola University of Chicago Medical Center. The amendment aims to allow home loan guaranties for energy efficiency improvements and extend the period of the Vietnam era.
